text: Psalm 17
Prayer for Vindication and Protection
A prayer of David.\f + \fr Ps 17 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O Yahweh, hear a just cause.
Hear my cry; heed my prayer
\add I make\add* without deceitful lips.
Let my vindication come forth from you;
let your eyes see fairness.
You have tried my heart;
you have examined \add me\add* by night;
you have tested me; you found nothing.
I have decided \add that\add* my mouth will not transgress.
As for \add the\add* works of humankind,
by the word of your lips,
I have kept \add from\add* the ways of \add the\add* violent.
\add I have\add* held my steps in your path
My feet will not slip.
As for me, I have called on you
because you will answer me, O God.
Incline your ear to me.
Hear my words.\f + \fr 17:6 \ft Hebrew “word” \f*
Show wondrously your acts of loyal love,
O Savior of those who take refuge
at your right hand\f + \fr 17:7 \ft Or “saving by your right hand those” \f*
from those who rise up against \add them\add*.
Keep me as ⸤the apple of your eye⸥.\f + \fr 17:8 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft little man of the daughter of \fq your \ft eye” \f*
Hide me in the shadow of your wings
from \add the\add* ⸤presence⸥\f + \fr 17:9 \ft Literally “face” \f* of \add the\add* wicked who destroy me,
\add those\add* enemies against my life,
\add they that\add* surround me.
They have shut off their calloused\f + \fr 17:10 \ft Or “fat” \f* \add heart\add*;
\add with\add* their mouth they speak arrogantly.
Now they surround us at our \add every\add* step.
They ⸤intend⸥\f + \fr 17:11 \ft Literally “set their eyes” \f*
⸤to pin⸥\f + \fr 17:11 \ft Literally “to stretch” \f* \add me\add* to the ground.
⸤He is like⸥\f + \fr 17:12 \ft Literally “His image” \f* a lion; he longs to tear apart,
and like a strong lion crouching in hiding places.
Rise up, O Yahweh, confront ⸤him⸥.\f + \fr 17:13 \ft Literally “his face” \f*
Make him bow down.
Rescue with your sword my life from \add the\add* wicked,
from men by your hand, O Yahweh, from men of \add this\add* world.
Their share \add is\add* in ⸤this life⸥,\f + \fr 17:14 \ft Literally “the life” \f* and you fill their stomach \add with\add* your treasure.
They are satisfied \add with\add* children.
They bequeath their excess to their children.
\add By contrast,\add* I in righteousness shall see your face.
Upon awakening I will be satisfied \add seeing\add* your form.
